label: thm-expected-cloning-action-continuity
name: Continuity of the Conditional Expected Cloning Action
statement:
The **Conditional Expected Cloning Action** is continuous with respect to changes in both the swarm structure and the fitness potential vector. For any two states $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{V}_1)$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{V}_2)$, with $k_1 = |\mathcal{A}(\mathcal{S}_1)| > 0$, the change in the conditional expected action for any walker $i$ is bounded:

$$
|P_{\text{clone}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{V}_1)_i - P_{\text{clone}}(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{V}_2)_i| \le C_{\text{struct}}^{(\pi)}(k_1) \cdot n_c(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) + C_{\text{val}}^{(\pi)} \cdot \left( \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_1)}[|V_{1,c} - V_{2,c}|] + |V_{1,i} - V_{2,i}| \right)
$$

where the coefficients are:
- $C_{\text{struct}}^{(\pi)}(k_1) := \frac{2}{\max(1, k_1-1)}$ (from structural change)
- $C_{\text{val}}^{(\pi)} := \max(L_{\pi,c}, L_{\pi,i})$ (from potential vector change)
hypotheses: Two states with swarm structure and potential vectors
conclusion: Conditional expected cloning action is continuous in both structure and values
proof_technique: Decomposition into structural and value components using triangle inequality
context: Section 16: The Cloning Transition Measure, subsection 15.2.3
relations_established: Expected cloning action is continuous with respect to swarm state
